data.title: The Robert Schuman Foundation the Research and Studies Centre on Europe
data.text:
CROATIA

PDF

In English - version of 9th July 2024

Geography

Area : 56,542 km²

Borders : 2,197 km, Bosnia and Herzegovina 932 km, Hungary 329 km, Serbia 241 km, Montenegro 25 km, Slovenia 670 km

Coastline : 5,835 km (Adriatic Sea) (Continental: 1,777 km; Islands: 4,058 km)

Capital : Zagreb

Official language : Croatian

Flag

Population

Population : 4,169,239 inhabitants (est. 2023)

Crude natural change rate : -6‰ (2022)

Population repartition : 14% under 15 years; 22.6% over 65 years and more (est. 2023)

Foreign residents : EU nationals 1%, extra-EU nationals 2% (2021)

Crude net migration rate : -0.3‰ (est. 2023)

First time asylum applicants : 12,870 (2022)

Life expectancy : men 74.4 years, women 80.8 years (est. 2023)

Religions : Roman Catholic 86.3%, Orthodox 4.4%, Muslim 1.5%, other 1.5%, unspecified 2.5%, atheist 3.8% (2011)

Source : Eurostat, The World Factbook

Economy

Currency : Euro

GDP : € 66,939 million (2022)

GDP per capita (PPS) : € 14,540 (2022)

GDP growth : 1.6% (2023)

Inflation : 4.3% (May 2024)

Public debt : 68.4% (December 2022)

Unemployment : 5.3% (May 2024)

Stock of foreign direct investment from the entire world : 54.7% of GDP (2022)

Performance sectors : tourism, buildings and construction, trade, banking, chemistry, textile

Budget balance : -8.1% (Q4 2023)

Source : Eurostat, National bank of Croatia

Political system

Parliamentary republic

Head of State: Zoran Milanović (Social Democratic Party SDP), elected on 5th January 2020 (invested on 18th February 2020) for five years by direct universal suffrage.

Prime Minister: Andrej Plenkovic since 19th October 2016 and reelected on April 27th 2024 for 4 years. He leads a coalition between HDZ and the Patriotic movement (DP).

Monocameral parliamentary regime: The Parliament (Hrvatski Sabor) comrising 151 seats; representatives are elected for four years by direct universal suffrage according to proportional representation.

Political representation

Current composition of Parliament (after the elections of 5th July 2020):

61 seats HDZ (Croatian Democratic Union)

42 seats SDP (Social Democratic Party)

9 seats DPMS (Patriotic Movement)

14 seats MOST (Bridge of Independent Lists)

8 seats national minorities/ independants

10 seats We can ! (Mozemo!)

1 seat Independent platform of the North

4 seats IDS (Istrian Democratic Assembly)

Women's representations

in government: 2/18

in Parliament: 51/151

Next Elections :

general in 2028 and presidential in 2025

CROATIA
